entry.title: Python Notes I
entry.content:
Work effectively with IDLE

  • Press TAB key, IDLE will offer suggestions to help you complete your statement
  • Press Alt-P to recall the previous code statement and press Alt-N to move to the next code statement

Deal with Python list

  • Python’s variable identifiers don’t have a type, Python’s list is a high-level collection
  • Using print() and len() to work out how many data items are in the list “`

    animal = [“Dog”, ‘Pig’, ‘Cat’, “Duck”] print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Pig’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’] print(len(cast)) 4 print(animal[1]) Pig “`

  • Using append(), extend() and pop() method to add and remove data from the list “`

    animal.append(“Tiger”) print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Pig’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’, ‘Tiger’] animal.pop() ‘Tiger’ print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Pig’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’] animal.extend([“Fish”, “Bird”]) print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Pig’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’, ‘Fish’, ‘Bird’] “`

  • Using remove() and insert() to find and remove/add a specific data from list “`

    animal.remove(“Pig”) print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’, ‘Fish’, ‘Bird’] animal.insert(1, “Bull”) print(animal) [‘Dog’, ‘Bull’, ‘Cat’, ‘Duck’, ‘Fish’, ‘Bird’] “`

  • For loops work with lists of any size animals = ["Dog", 'Pig', 'Cat', "Duck", "Fish"] for each_animal in animals: print each_animal
